data.title: Sega lindbergh arcade game
data.meta_description: Hello everyone, first of all I wish you a good forum. I struggled a lot to find this forum page. I am reaching you from Turkey, I work in the technical...
data.text:
Hello everyone, first of all I wish you a good forum. I struggled a lot to find this forum page. I am reaching you from Turkey, I work in the technical service of an entertainment and arcade hall. My English is not very good, the video card in the (yellow) Lindbergh computer case in the Hammer arcade game in our business has burned, I want to replace it with a new one, but I cannot log in to the windows screen or login. bios. Can anyone help with this?

Attachments

IMG20230808105524.jpg

IMG20230808105542.jpg

IMG20230808105518.jpg

Hello,

Why do you want to go in the Bios?

if you are sure you want to go there and risk breaking the one that works, see HERE for a procedure ... in french! (scroll down a bit)

You need a 7800GS card with a specific bios

For this price, you might as well buy the whole thing: https://www.ebay.com/itm/165936727872 and have spare parts. ( shipping is not specified... best of luck)

Hello,

Why do you want to go in the Bios?

if you are sure you want to go there and risk breaking the one that works, see HERE for a procedure ... in french! (scroll down a bit)

You need a 7800GS card with a specific bios

For this price, you might as well buy the whole thing: https://www.ebay.com/itm/165936727872 and have spare parts. ( shipping is not specified... best of luck)

I was actually just hopping on the forum to look into a graphics card issue. I just got a non-working Lindy Yellow and it appears that the graphics card is dead. Power pins are fine, but no fan spin and no output. I get an alarm when I remove it so the AGP slot appears fine. I heard that the Lindy uses TPM, but I wasn't sure if that applied to the graphics card.

I saw another 7800 online with a higher bios version, so I guess that's out unless I can downgrade the card bios or somehow turn off TPM?

Also, I thought these boards came with a GeForce 6 series GPU? Sega Retro and others indicate a 6 series and I visually saw a few Lindy's online with a 6. Is it possible that these are swappable?
